kalim.c

00001 /* kalim.c - example of an object which puts up its own graphics window
00002 
00003     original version by Miller Puckette 1989-ish
00004     updated by DDZ 6/5/95
00005     codewarrior port October 96 -Rd
00006     updated for the Max4 SDK with a generous dash of herbs, spices and improvements, Aug/Dec 2001 -Rd
00007 */
00008 
00009 #include "ext.h"
00010 #include "ext_common.h"
00011 #include "ext_wind.h"
00012 
00013 #include "ext_qtstubs.h"
00014 
00015 // constants which describe the appearance of kalim's graphic editor
00016 #define ROW 64      // number of rows
00017 #define COLUMN 64   // number of columns
00018 #define SQ 2        // half of square size (i.e. distance from center of square to edge)
00019 #define PIX 5       // distance between square centers
00020 #define XMARGIN 5   // margins from edge of window
00021 #define YMARGIN 5
00022 
00023 // definitions of macros which use the above constants
00024 #define RIGHT (XMARGIN + COLUMN * PIX + 1)
00025 #define BOTTOM (YMARGIN + ROW * PIX + 1)
00026 #define XLOC(x) (XMARGIN + (x) * PIX + PIX) // convert COLUMN index to horiz pixel location
00027 #define YLOC(x) ((BOTTOM-YMARGIN) - (x) * PIX + PIX) // convert ROW index to vert pixel location
00028 #define XVAL(x) ((((x)-SQ) - XMARGIN) / PIX)    // convert horiz click location to COLUMN index
00029 #define YVAL(x) ((BOTTOM - ((x)-SQ)) / PIX)     // convert vert click location to ROW index
00030 
00031 typedef struct _kalim
00032 {
00033     t_object k_ob;      // our object header
00034     t_wind *k_wind;     // pointer to our object's own window
00035     void *k_qelem;      // queue element used for redraw
00036     long k_current;     // current column value in leftmost inlet (last column output)
00037     long k_n1;          // stored value in 2nd inlet
00038     long k_n2;          // stored value in 3rd inlet
00039     char k_shit[COLUMN][ROW]; // this is our matrix of on/off values
00040     short k_set;        // flag used to store data if value has been received in 2nd inlet
00041 } t_kalim;
00042 
00043 void main(void);
00044 void blacken(short y, short z);
00045 void whiten(short y, short z);
00046 void kalim_update(t_kalim *x);
00047 void kalim_click(t_kalim *x, Point pt, short dbl, short mod);
00048 void kalim_drag(t_kalim *x, Point pt, short but);
00049 void kalim_shiftdrag(t_kalim *x, Point pt, short but);
00050 void kalim_dblclick(t_kalim *x);
00051 void kalim_close(t_kalim *x);
00052 void kalim_open(t_kalim *x);
00053 void kalim_wclose(t_kalim *x);
00054 void kalim_int(t_kalim *x, long n);
00055 void kalim_float(t_kalim *x, double f);
00056 void kalim_in1(t_kalim *x, long n);
00057 void kalim_in2(t_kalim *x, long n);
00058 void kalim_clear(t_kalim *x);
00059 void kalim_assist(t_kalim *x, void *b, long m, long a, char *s);
00060 void kalim_free(t_kalim *x);
00061 void *kalim_new(void);
00062 
00063 void *kalim_class;
00064 short switched; // global variable used in kalim_click and kalim_drag
00065 
00066 // some handy colors
00067 RGBColor myBlack = {0,0,0};
00068 RGBColor myWhite = {65535,65535,65535};
00069 RGBColor myCinnamon = {42000,200,200};
00070 RGBColor myMint = {48000,65535,48000};
00071 
00072 void main(void)
00073 {   
00074     // set up the class creator's arguments and the instance size
00075     setup((t_messlist **)&kalim_class, (method)kalim_new, (method)kalim_free, (short)sizeof(t_kalim), 0L, 0);
00076     
00077     // the following methods can be sent via typed messages in the patcher
00078     addint((method)kalim_int);                          // "int" method
00079     addfloat((method)kalim_float);                      // "float" method (converted to int)
00080     addinx((method)kalim_in1,1);                        // "int" in first inlet (after leftmost)
00081     addinx((method)kalim_in2,2);                        // "int" in 2nd inlet
00082     addmess((method)kalim_clear,    "clear",    0);     // clear all values (added - oct 96)
00083     addmess((method)kalim_open,     "open",     0);     // standard max message to open window remotely
00084     addmess((method)kalim_wclose,   "wclose",   0);     // standard max message to close window remotely
00085     
00086     // the following methods handle messages sent by Max and thus can't be typechecked
00087     addmess((method)kalim_update,   "update",   A_CANT, 0);
00088     addmess((method)kalim_click,    "click",    A_CANT, 0);
00089     addmess((method)kalim_dblclick, "dblclick", A_CANT, 0);
00090     addmess((method)kalim_close,    "close",    A_CANT, 0);
00091     addmess((method)kalim_assist,   "assist",   A_CANT, 0);
00092 }
00093 
00094 void blacken(short y, short z)
00095 {
00096     short n1 = XLOC(y), n2 = YLOC(z);
00097     Rect r;
00098     
00099     MacSetRect(&r, n1-SQ, n2-SQ, n1+SQ, n2+SQ);
00100     PaintRect(&r);
00101 }
00102 
00103 void whiten(short y, short z)
00104 {
00105     short n1 = XLOC(y), n2 = YLOC(z);
00106     Rect r;
00107     
00108     MacSetRect(&r, n1-SQ, n2-SQ, n1+SQ, n2+SQ);
00109     EraseRect(&r); 
00110 }
00111 
00112 void kalim_update(t_kalim *x)
00113 {
00114     GrafPtr gp; // pointer to current GrafPort
00115     short h, v;
00116     
00117     // set the GrafPort to kalim's wind and get and store a pointer to the current GrafPort
00118     gp = XQT_wind_setport(x->k_wind);
00119     if (gp) {
00120         // erasing our graphic window is no longer necessary in this version 
00121         //   ...but this would be the logical place to do it if we still needed to
00122         //SetRect (&r, XMARGIN, YMARGIN, XMARGIN+RIGHT, YMARGIN+BOTTOM);
00123         //EraseRect (&r);
00124         
00125         for (h = 0; h < COLUMN; h++) {
00126             char *foo = x->k_shit[h];
00127             if (h == x->k_current) {
00128                 // only change color if this is the most recently output column
00129                 RGBForeColor(&myCinnamon);
00130                 RGBBackColor(&myMint);
00131             }
00132             for (v = 0; v < ROW; v++) {
00133                 foo[v]?blacken(h,v):whiten(h,v); // this is where we're now erasing our squares!
00134             }
00135             
00136             if (h == x->k_current) {
00137                 // change the color back only if we have previously changed it
00138                 RGBForeColor(&myBlack);
00139                 RGBBackColor(&myWhite);
00140             }
00141         }
00142         XQT_SetPort(gp); // restore the saved GrafPort after drawing
00143     }
00144 }
00145 
00146 
00147 
00148 void kalim_click(t_kalim *x, Point pt, short dbl, short modifiers)
00149 {
00150     if(modifiers & shiftKey) {
00151         // if the shift key is held down while clicking on kalim's window use this drag method...
00152         wind_drag((method)kalim_shiftdrag, x, pt);
00153         kalim_shiftdrag(x, pt, 1);
00154     }
00155     else {
00156         // ...otherwise use the standard drag method
00157         switched = 0;
00158         wind_drag((method)kalim_drag, x, pt);
00159         kalim_drag(x, pt, 1);
00160     }
00161 }
00162 
00163 void kalim_drag(t_kalim *x, Point pt, short but)
00164 {
00165     GrafPtr gp; // pointer to current GrafPort
00166     short xval, yval;
00167     
00168     if (!but)       
00169         return; // if there's no mouse button being held down, then stop dragging and exit
00170     
00171     gp = XQT_wind_setport(x->k_wind);
00172     if (gp) {
00173         xval = XVAL(pt.h);
00174         yval = YVAL(pt.v);
00175         if (xval < 0 || xval >= COLUMN || yval < 0 || yval >= ROW) 
00176             return;
00177         if (!switched) 
00178             switched = (x->k_shit[xval][yval] ? 2 : 1); // first click determines erase/add
00179         if (switched == 1) {
00180             x->k_shit[xval][yval] = 1;
00181             blacken(xval, yval);
00182         }
00183         else { // switch must be 2
00184             x->k_shit[xval][yval] = 0;
00185             whiten(xval, yval);
00186         }
00187         XQT_SetPort(gp);
00188     }
00189 }
00190 
00191 void kalim_shiftdrag(t_kalim *x, Point pt, short but)
00192 {
00193     short xval, savelock;
00194     
00195     if (!but)
00196         return; // if there's no mouse button being held down, then stop dragging and exit
00197 
00198     xval = XVAL(pt.h);
00199     
00200     if (xval < 0 || xval >= COLUMN) 
00201         return;
00202     
00203     if (xval != x->k_current) {
00204         short v;
00205         char *foo = x->k_shit[xval];
00206         
00207         x->k_current = xval;
00208         
00209         savelock = lockout_set(1);  // inhibit interrupt-level processing 
00210                                     // we need to do this if we output values as a result of a click/drag
00211         for (v = 0; v < ROW; v++)
00212             if (foo[v])
00213                 outlet_int(x->k_ob.o_outlet, (long)v);
00214         
00215         lockout_set(savelock);      // restore the value we received above
00216 
00217         qelem_set(x->k_qelem); // set queue element so the queue function does a redraw when there's time
00218     }
00219 }
00220 
00221 void kalim_dblclick(t_kalim *x)
00222 {
00223     // couldn't be simpler - just let Max deal with opening up the window
00224     wind_vis(x->k_wind);
00225 }
00226 
00227 void kalim_close(t_kalim *x)
00228 {
00229     // couldn't be simpler - just let Max deal with closing the window
00230     wind_invis(x->k_wind);
00231 }
00232 
00233 void kalim_open(t_kalim *x)
00234 {
00235     // messages sent from within max must be deferred if they do things like open windows, etc...
00236     defer(x,(method)kalim_dblclick,0,0,0); 
00237 }
00238 
00239 void kalim_wclose(t_kalim *x)
00240 {
00241     // messages sent from within max must be deferred if they do things like close windows, etc...
00242     defer(x,(method)kalim_close,0,0,0);
00243 }
00244 
00245 void kalim_int(t_kalim *x, long n)
00246 {
00247     if (x->k_set) {
00248         // if we just received something in the second inlet then store it in k_shit matrix
00249         n = CLIP(n, 0, COLUMN-1); // constrain our x value
00250         x->k_shit[n][x->k_n1] = x->k_n2;
00251         x->k_set = 0;
00252     }
00253     else if (InRange(x->k_current = n, 0, COLUMN-1)) { // only play notes if n is in range
00254         short v;
00255         char *foo = x->k_shit[n];
00256         for (v = 0; v < ROW; v++) 
00257             if (foo[v]) 
00258                 outlet_int(x->k_ob.o_outlet, (long)v);
00259     }
00260     qelem_set(x->k_qelem); // set queue element so the queue function does a redraw when there's time
00261 }
00262 
00263 void kalim_float(t_kalim *x, double f)
00264 {
00265     kalim_int(x, (long)f);
00266 }
00267 
00268 void kalim_in1(t_kalim *x, long n)
00269 {
00270     x->k_n1 = CLIP(n, 0, ROW-1); // constrain and store our y value
00271     x->k_set = 1; // set the set flag so the next incoming x value stores instead of causes output
00272 }
00273 
00274 void kalim_in2(t_kalim *x, long n)
00275 {
00276     x->k_n2 = n==0?0:1; // constrain our on/off value and store it
00277 }
00278 
00279 void kalim_clear(t_kalim *x)
00280 {
00281     short i, j;
00282     
00283     for (i = 0; i < COLUMN; i++) 
00284         for (j = 0; j < ROW; j++) 
00285             x->k_shit[i][j] = 0;
00286     
00287     qelem_set(x->k_qelem); // set queue element so the queue function does a redraw when there's time
00288 }
00289 
00290 void kalim_assist(t_kalim *x, void *b, long m, long a, char *s)
00291 {
00292     if (m == ASSIST_INLET) {
00293         switch (a) {    
00294         case 0:
00295             sprintf(s, "x location");
00296             break;
00297         case 1:
00298             sprintf(s, "y location");
00299             break;
00300         case 2:
00301             sprintf(s, "value (0/1)");
00302             break;
00303         }
00304     }
00305     else
00306         sprintf(s, "y value out");
00307 }
00308 
00309 void kalim_free(t_kalim *x)
00310 {
00311     freeobject((t_object *)x->k_wind);  // use freeobject() to free a window
00312     qelem_free(x->k_qelem);             // free the queue element
00313 }
00314 
00315 void *kalim_new(void)
00316 {
00317     t_kalim *x;
00318     
00319     x = (t_kalim *)newobject(kalim_class);
00320     // create our object's color graphics window (not initially visible)
00321     x->k_wind = wind_new(x, 50, 50, 50+XMARGIN*2+RIGHT, 50+YMARGIN*2+BOTTOM, WCOLOR | WCLOSE);
00322     x->k_qelem = qelem_new(x, (method)kalim_update); // kalim_update is used as our queue function
00323     intin(x, 2);
00324     intin(x, 1);
00325     intout(x);
00326     x->k_n1 = x->k_n2 = 0;
00327     x->k_set = 0;
00328     x->k_current = -1; // initially set the current play position to -1 so it doesn't draw
00329     kalim_clear(x);
00330     return (x);
00331 }
